question.body: The dermis layer is the most superficial layer of the skin.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The dermis is not the superficial (top) layer of the skin.
Correct. The epidermis is the most superficial layer of the skin.

question.body: Which of the following is not part of the integumentary system?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The dermis is one of the main structures of the skin. It contains the blood vessels which provide nutrients to the cells of the epidermis.
Incorrect. Hairs are located all over our body and are structures in the integumentary system.
Incorrect. Sebaceous glands produce sebum or oil which helps to lubricate hair and form a chemical barrier on our epidermis.
Correct. The hypodermis is below the dermis and not considered part of the integumentary system.

part.hint: This question is a little tricky, but only one structure below is not technically part of the integumentary system.

question.body: Which of the following functions to prevent water loss from the skin?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Collagen is a structurally important component of the skin and maintains the integrity of the skin.
Correct. Keratin is made and released from cells of the epidermis and forms a barrier to decrease water loss from the skin.
Incorrect. Melanin is an important pigment that protects the cells from UV radiation.
Incorrect. Vitamin D is made in the skin but functions for calcium absorption and protects us from various cancers.

part.hint: This protein is a main ingredient in body lotions.
